sen.j: 粟田 真人（あわた の まひと、生年不詳 - 養老3年2月5日 (旧暦)（719年2月28日））は、飛鳥時代後期から奈良時代にかけての貴族。
sen.e: AWATA no Mahito (year of birth unknown - February 28, 719) is a court noble from the latter half of the Asuka Period through until the Nara period.
AWATA no Mahito (year of birth unknown - February 28, 719) is a court noble from the latter half of the Asuka period through until the Nara period.
sen.cmt: ・「飛鳥時代」のperiodの冒頭が大文字になっていたので小文字に変更しました。
sen.e: AWATA no Mahito (year of birth unknown - February 28, 719) is a court noble from the latter half of the Asuka period through until the Nara period.

sen.j: 遣唐使。
sen.e: A Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China; Kento-shi (Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China).
A Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China; Kento-shi (Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China).

sen.j: 粟田氏は春日氏・和珥氏らと同系で山城国に本拠を持つ一族。
sen.e: The Awata clan is a family that is descended from the same origin as the Awata clan and Kasuga clan, based on Yamashiro Province.
The Awata clan is a family that is descended from the same origin as the Kasuga clan and Wani clan, based on Yamashiro Province.
sen.cmt: ・「春日氏・和珥氏」の英語表記が違っていたので修正しました。
sen.e: The Awata clan is a family that is descended from the same origin as the Kasuga clan and Wani clan, based on Yamashiro Province.

sen.j: 粟田島の子。
sen.e: He is a child of Awata no shima.
He is a child of Awata no shima.
He is a child of Awata no shima.

sen.j: 正三位・中納言。
sen.e: He is Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).

sen.j: 天武天皇10年（681年）冠位・官位制度の変遷（後の従五位下に相当）となる。
sen.e: In 681 (in 10 in the era of Emperor Tenmu), he became hensen (corresponding to Jugoinoge [Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade]) in the cap rank and official rank system.
In 681, he became hensen (corresponding to Jugoinoge [Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade]) in the cap rank and official rank system.
In 681, he became hensen (corresponding to Jugoinoge [Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade]) in the cap rank and official rank system.

sen.j: 同13年（684年）八色の姓制定に伴い、朝臣を賜る。
sen.e: In 684, he was granted Ason (second highest of the eight hereditary titles) when the eight honorary titles were established.
In 684, he was granted Ason (second highest of Yakusa no Kabane or the eight hereditary titles) when the eight honorary titles were established.
sen.cmt: ・具体性を出すため「八色の姓」の読みを追加しました。
sen.e: In 684, he was granted Ason (second highest of Yakusa no Kabane or the eight hereditary titles) when the eight honorary titles were established.

sen.j: 持統天皇3年（689年）には太宰府となり、隼人174人、布50常、牛鹿皮50余枚を献上した。
sen.e: In 689, he became Dazaifu, and presented 174 members of Hayato (ancient tribe in Kyushu), 50 jo of cloth, and 50 or more sheets of cow or deer hide.
In 689, he became Dazaifu (Government Headquarters in Kyushu), and presented 174 members of Hayato (ancient tribe in Kyushu), 50 jo of cloth, and 50 or more sheets of cow or deer hide.
sen.cmt: ・「大宰府」は用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: In 689, he became Dazaifu (Government Headquarters in Kyushu), and presented 174 members of Hayato (ancient tribe in Kyushu), 50 jo of cloth, and 50 or more sheets of cow or deer hide.

sen.j: また、忍壁皇子・藤原不比等らとともに大宝律令の編纂に参画した。
sen.e: He was engaged in compiling Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code) together with Osakabe no Miko (Prince Osakabe) and FUJIWARA no Fuhito.
sen.cmt: 本列は後列と一文であると判断したため結合し、その後分割して訳出しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He was engaged in compiling Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code) together with Osakabe no Miko (Prince Osakabe) and FUJIWARA no Fuhito.
He was engaged in compiling Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code) together with Osakabe no Miko (Prince Osakabe) and FUJIWARA no Fuhito.

sen.j: 大宝 (日本)元年（701年）正月には直大弐（従四位上）民部省に任ぜられ、あわせて遣唐使に任命され、文武天皇から節刀を授けられた。
sen.e: On New year's holidays, he was appointed to jikidaini (the eleventh grade of jikidai rank for vassals of the forty-eight grades of cap rank, which corresponds to Jushiinojo, Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade of Taiho Ritsuryo, Taiho Code) Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs) and to a Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China, and he was granted setto (a sword given by the emperor in the symbol of his trust to the appointment of someone to a mission) by Emperor Mommu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On January 701, he was appointed to jikidaini (the eleventh grade of jikidai rank for vassals of the forty-eight grades of cap rank, which corresponds to Jushiinojo, Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade of Taiho Ritsuryo, Taiho Code) Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs) and to a Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China, and he was granted setto (a sword given by the emperor in the symbol of his trust to the appointment of someone to a mission) by Emperor Mommu.
sen.cmt: ・「701年正月」の部分がなかったので追加しました。ちなみに昔でいう正月は正月休みではなく、一月のことを意味するそうで、それを基に修正しました。
sen.e: On January 701, he was appointed to jikidaini (the eleventh grade of jikidai rank for vassals of the forty-eight grades of cap rank, which corresponds to Jushiinojo, Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade of Taiho Ritsuryo, Taiho Code) Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs) and to a Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China, and he was granted setto (a sword given by the emperor in the symbol of his trust to the appointment of someone to a mission) by Emperor Mommu.

sen.j: これが天皇が節刀（遣唐使や征夷将軍などに軍事大権の象徴として授けられた）を授けた初例という。
sen.e: This is said to be the first case of setto which an emperor granted someone (among the cases of setto which were given to Kento-shi [Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China] or seii shogun [great general who subdues the barbarians] as a symbol of authority over the military power).

This is said to be the first case of setto which an emperor granted someone (among the cases of setto which were given to Kento-shi [Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China] or seii shogun [great general who subdues the barbarians] as a symbol of authority over the military power).

sen.j: 翌702年5月に参議となって朝政に参加。
sen.e: In May 702, he became engaged in the government by the Imperial Court as Sangi (councilor); the Councilor.
In May 702, he became engaged in the government by the Imperial Court as Sangi (councilor); the Councilor.
sen.cmt: ・Councilorが重複していたので一方を削除しました。
sen.e: In May 702, he became engaged in the government by the Imperial Court as Sangi (councilor); the Councilor.

sen.j: 同年6月大宝律令を携えて唐（正確にはこの時代、唐は存在しておらず、武則天（則天武后）が新たに建てた武周である）へ渡った。
sen.e: In July in the same year, he went to Tang Dynasty (to be exact, this is the Bushu Dynasty established by Busokuten [Empress Sokuten] as Tang was not established at that time).
In June 702, he went to Tang Dynasty (to be exact, this is the Bushu Dynasty established by Busokuten [Empress Sokuten] as Tang was not established at that time).
sen.cmt: ・年号（月）が原文と違っていたので修正しました。・「原文」で同年とありましたが、より具体性を出すために直前の文を参考に702を追加しました。
sen.e: In June 702, he went to Tang Dynasty (to be exact, this is the Bushu Dynasty established by Busokuten [Empress Sokuten] as Tang was not established at that time).

sen.j: 663年の白村江の戦いで倭と唐が敵対して以来初の本格的な使節派遣である。
sen.e: He was the first envoy who was dispatched since Wa and Tang confronted at the Battle of Hakusukinoe in 663.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was the first envoy who was dispatched since Wa and Tang confronted at the Battle of Hakusukinoe in 663.
He was the first envoy who was dispatched since Wa and Tang confronted at the Battle of Hakusukinoe in 663.

sen.j: 国交回復の意味を持った遣使であると同時に、律令制度の整備や、倭から日本への国号変更の通達など、様々な目的を持った使節であった。
sen.e: Not only he was an envoy who was dispatched with the intention of restoring relations between them, but he was also an envoy who was dispatched with various intentions including development of the ritsuryo system and announcement of change in the name of the country, from Wa to Nihon (Japan).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was an envoy who was dispatched not only with the intention of restoring relations between them, but also with various intentions including development of the ritsuryo system and announcement of change in the name of the country, from Wa to Nihon (Japan).
sen.cmt: ・he was an envoy who was dispatchedの部分が重複しているので1つにまとめました。
sen.e: He was an envoy who was dispatched not only with the intention of restoring relations between them, but also with various intentions including development of the ritsuryo system and announcement of change in the name of the country, from Wa to Nihon (Japan).

sen.j: 同遣唐使には山上憶良や道慈らも加わっている。
sen.e: YAMANOUE no Okura or Doji participated in a troop of envoys to Tang.
YAMANOUE no Okura and Doji also participated in the diplomatic mission.
sen.cmt: ・troopを使うと軍事的な意味が強くなるので外交使節団と置き換えました。・名前をつなぐ「や」はこの場合andの方が正確であると判断し、変更しました。・「も」にあたる英訳がなかったので追加しました。
sen.e: YAMANOUE no Okura and Doji also participated in the diplomatic mission.

sen.j: 翌年、都の長安に到着、武則天に謁見した。
sen.e: In the following year, he arrived at Changan; the capital, had an audience with Busokuten.
In the following year, he arrived at Changan; the capital, had an audience with Busokuten.

sen.j: 唐人からは「好く経史を読み、属文を解し、容止温雅なり」と評されたという。
sen.e: The people in Tang remarked him by saying 'he read plenty of Chinese history books and understands writing. He was graceful in manner.'
sen.cmt: 好く経史を読み、属文を解し、容止温雅なり→定訳不明ですが左記のように推測し訳出しています。
sen.e: The people in Tang remarked him by saying 'he read plenty of Chinese history books and understands writing. He was graceful in manner.'

sen.e: Busokuten appointed him to 司膳員外郎.

sen.e: Busokuten appointed him to 司膳員外郎.

sen.j: 慶雲元年（704年）、白村江の戦い以来捕虜になっていた者を連れて帰国。
sen.e: In 704, he came back to Japan with prisoners who had been held captive since the Battle of Hakusukinoe.

sen.j: 功績により大和国に田20町、穀1000石を賜った。
sen.e: Because of his achievement, he was granted 20 towns of rice field and 1,000 koku of crops.
Because of his achievement, he was granted 20 towns of rice field and 1,000 koku (180.39 cubic meters) of crops.

sen.j: 入唐で得た知識を生かすべく慶雲の改革において中納言に任命された。
sen.e: He was appointed to Chunagon (middle counselor) in Keiun no kaikaku (political reform in Keiun era) to utilize the knowledge which he acquired during his stay in Tang.

sen.e: He engaged in the reform of system just after the enforcement of the ritsuryo system.

sen.e: Later, he successively served as Dazai no sochi (Governor-General of the Dazai-fu offices), and was promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) in 715.
